intro: Licania cariae, commonly known as the Brazilian palm, is a species of flowering plant in the Arecaceae family. It is native to Brazil and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are arranged in compound inflorescences. Licania cariae is often found in tropical rainforests and is adapted to grow in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecological diversity in its native habitat.
